result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcos T Escobedo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Negligent Operation of Motor Vehicle, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at $50.00 per month commencing on 04-01-2016 or serve 9 days jail, consecutive, as penalty for non payment.
Restitution for David J. to be paid along with fine payments.
With Huber release for standard conditions.  Apply credit of 2 days.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcos T Escobedo

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marcos T Escobedo in court with attorney Kelsey Morin.  Ted Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.      The defendant was sentenced to the following:

COUNT #1:

HUBER:  15 days, w/Standard Release Conditions (Apply credit - 2 Days). Defendant to report to Huber facility by 6:00 p.m. on Friday, March 5, 2016.

FINE: $442.00 (to pay $50.00 month commencing 4/1/16 or serve 9 days jail, consecutive, as penalty for non payment of fine);

DNA SURCHARGE: waived based on date of violation.

RESITTUTION: $102.90 payable to David J. (restitution to be paid before payment on fines/costs.)
Restitution hearing at 02-17-2016 03:15 pm
Sentencing hearing at 02-17-2016 03:15 pm

Defendant Marcos T Escobedo in court with attorney Nicole M Masnica.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1,  Court finds defendant guilty on count #1 of the amended information.   The Court sets the matter for a sentencing/restitution hearing in about 30 days.  Bail remains as set.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 17, 2016 at 03:15 pm.  Restitution hearing scheduled for February 17, 2016 at 03:15 pm.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Defendant Marcos T Escobedo in court with attorney Nicole M Masnica.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Officer Joseph Talfa from the City of Waukesha was sworn and testified on behalf of the State. Cross examination by the defense. Redirect by the state. State rests. No testimony by the defense. Testimony is closed. State moves for bind over and presents arguments. Defense objects and presents arguments.   Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Preliminary hearing on June 19, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Marcos T Escobedo in court with attorney Nicole M Masnica.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Masnica is requesting adjournment. State has no objections. Court grants the request.  Bail remains as fixed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 14, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing

Defendant Marcos T Escobedo in court, in custody, with attorney Nicole M Masnica.   Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Preliminary Hearing requested  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 14, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
